tests.explanation: The original program compares the positions (i-1) and (j-1) of the array pq to check if the string in the i-th position is less than the string in the j-th position. The mutant code uses expressions (i - 0) and (j - 1) which are equivalent to (i) and (j - 1), that is, it does no subtract 1 from i. This results in comparing the wrong indices of the array and causing the program output to be different from the original one.

The chosen test case verifies if the program can sort strings of different sizes. The original program outputs 1 because it sorts the strings correctly, while the mutant program outputs 0 because it compares the wrong indices of the array pq, causing the strings to be incorrectly sorted.

The test case verifies if the program sorts capital letters appropriately. The original program outputs 1 because it sorts the strings correctly, while the mutant program outputs 0 because it compares the wrong indices of the array pq, causing the strings to be incorrectly sorted.
